package.name: ldap
package.title: LDAP
package.author: Elxis Team
package.description: Allows the login to an Elxis site by authenticating against an LDAP server. The logged in users are considered as External Users.

param.name: base_dn
param.label: Base DN
param.description: If empty, Elxis will try to search for it or even calculate it from the host name. Usually it is something like dc=mydomain,dc=com

param.name: user_dn
param.label: User DN
param.description: If empty elxis will try to calculate it by using ldap_username search option (see bellow) or uid=username. You can use the {username} keyword that will be replaced in the user_dn by the provided username during login. Example: uid={username},ou=People,dc=mydomain,dc=com

param.name: ldap_filter
param.label: LDAP filter
param.description: The search string to be used to retrieve user info. If empty Elxis will try to calculate it ldap_username if not empty, or other way. Example: (|(cn={username}*)(uid={username}))

param.name: ldap_firstname
param.label: First name
param.description: From where to retrieve the user first name. If empty then elxis will try to get it from the ldap_fullname option, else it will use the username as firstname. Example: firstname

param.name: ldap_lastname
param.label: Last name
param.description: From where to retrieve the user last name. If empty then elxis will try to get it from the ldap_fullname option, else it will be empty. Example: sn

param.name: ldap_fullname
param.label: Full name
param.description: From where to retrieve the user full name. Required only if you havent provided the ldap_firstname and ldap_lastname options above. Example: cn

param.name: ldap_email
param.label: E-mail
param.description: From where to retrieve the user email address. You can use the {username} keyword if the user username is similar or equal to his email address. Examples: mail, email, {username}@mydomain.com, {username}

param.name: ldap_username
param.label: Username
param.description: From where to retrieve the user username. Required only to calculate the values of some of the above options in case you have left them empty. Also required to get the users username in case the login username in not equal to his real username (i.e in case he uses his email address to login). Example: uid
